intro: Biophytum puliyangudiense, commonly known as the "Puliyangudi leaf plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern India. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
